channel.title: Commercial Arbitration on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Commercial Arbitration on 0x000216

item.title: Is the Luxembourg Court providing assistance in preliminary references and investment tribunals?
item.description: Hannes Lenk, PhD Candidate at the University of Gothenburg The connection between arbitral tribunals and the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) has been a source of legal debate for many years. While the present situation is straightforward and practical, it is not without controversy. Commercial arbitration tribunals are not seen as “courts or tribunals of a Member State” as defined by Article 267 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union (TFEU).
